title: Quick question. Has a rework ever change a champion's resource type?
body: I was thinking about reworks and I realized that even the most drastic reworks I'm aware of never changed the resource type of a champion. For example, from using energy to mana or adding mana to a resourceless champion. Has this ever happened?

replies.body:
I think Riven used ti have a special resource bar. But it was basically just the same as her passive indicator.

I cant think of anyone else tho

Are you referring to the Edge meter? 
Never happened, Riven babs couldn't handle having a gauge that wasn't the enemy HP. 

As far as I know, only Aatrox has changed resource bars - The blood well was repurposed to only his Ult revive, which was cut out, so he no longer has the Blood Well (his old resource filled up when he took damage/casted a spell with a HP cost, similar to Setts 'Gritt' mechanic)
Aatrox used to have health costs. Now he doesn't.
Oh yea. I forgot about him.
mmmmm.....I don't really consider his ammo a resource. It's more of an indicator than anything.

> [{quoted}](name=FioraWillCarry,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BOBQl7tu,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2020-01-18T08:13:30.501+0000)
>
> mmmmm.....I don't really consider his ammo a resource. It's more of an indicator than anything.

Would you consider e.g. Annie's stun counter and Rumble's heat bar to be indicators or resources? Graves expends his ammo to deal damage and can regenerate it by waiting or by using abilities, just like mana, energy, or Jhin's ammo. I think it still counts, even if only to two. :P

Thing is, Graves, Annie, and Jhin already have mana as a resource. Rumble is the only one for whom a solid argument can be made for heat being a resource. In general, I don't think we are meant to consider any champion as having multiple resources in the likes of mana, energy and rage(Tryndamere and Shyvana).
